title: Fix `cargo minimal-versions check`
body:
In a `Cargo.toml`, the dependency versions mean that those versions are the minimum versions required for the project to build.
Sadly, the minimum versions that are given right now will cause compiler errors.

This can be checked through the tool [`cargo-minimal-versions`](https://crates.io/crates/cargo-minimal-versions).

This change modifies the minimal versions so that `cargo minimal-versions check` now succeeds.

title: Add socket2 feature "all"
body:
Without this, I see
```rust
error[E0599]: no method named `bind_device` found for struct `Socket` in the current scope
   --> /home/jayvdb/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/hyper-util-0.1.1/src/client/legacy/connect/http.rs:704:14
    |
703 | /         socket
704 | |             .bind_device(Some(interface.as_bytes()))
    | |             -^^^^^^^^^^^ method not found in `Socket`
    | |_____________|
    | 

error[E0599]: no method named `with_retries` found for struct `TcpKeepalive` in the current scope
   --> /home/jayvdb/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-6f17d22bba15001f/hyper-util-0.1.1/src/client/legacy/connect/http.rs:130:12
    |
130 |         ka.with_retries(retries)
    |            ^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: there is a method with a similar name: `with_time`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0599`.
error: could not compile `hyper-util` (lib) due to 2 previous errors
```

title: use docsrs --cfg to turn on feature auto cfg
feat: reduce Send requirements on auto connections
Enable all feature flags when generating docs for docs.rs
body:
The documentation on docs.rs is empty at the moment, which is not very useful.
This PR enables the `full` feature flag when building docs for docs.rs to make sure all items are documented.

title: Feature flags: `server-auto` should imply `server`
body:
As it currently stands, enabling `server-auto` doesn't actually give you access to any new item _unless_ you also enable the `server` feature.
Considering how the code is structured, I think that the `server-auto` feature flag should imply the `server` feature flag.

title: move pool module to under legacy
make server auto::Connection use hyper's IO instead of Tokios
Re-expose connect::Error after #49
body: Since #49, we cannot refer to the Error response from the client. This exposes it again

title: clean up exposed crate features
body:
- Put `TokioExecutor` and `TokioIo` into a single `rt::tokio` module.
- The `rt::tokio` module is behind a `tokio` crate feature.
- Changed `auto` crate feature to `server-auto`.
- Added `client-legacy` crate feature, with `client::legacy` behind it.
- Removed `tcp` and `runtime` features, code now depends on the `tokio` feature.

title: feat: moved connect module to legacy
body:
Moved the `connect` module to the legacy namespace to make space for new changes. Renamed legacy.rs -> client.rs and also moved to that namespace.

Fixes: hyperium/hyper#3414

title: Update dependencies
body: Updates to 1.0 of hyper, http, and friends.

title: pool: use `Executor` trait instead of concrete type
body:
Alternative to https://github.com/hyperium/hyper-util/pull/24.

Currently, `Pool` cannot be used at all. It requires a concrete `Exec`, and that is private. The #24 PR simply made `Exec` public. However, there is already other things in this crate that require an `Exec` (`legacy::Client`).

This adapts `Pool` to follow the same pattern as used for `Client`, taking in a trait.

This change is NOT a breaking change, as `Pool` cannot be used at all currently, so no one could be broken.

title: chore(dependencies): remove once_cell crate version config
body: The `once_cell` crate version config seems not to be needed now.

title: chore(dependencies): update to pnet_datalink 0.34.0
body: Updates to `pnet_datalink` 0.34.0.

title: chore(ci): remove log version config
body: This config seems to be able to be removed as `hyper-util`'s MSRV is now larger than `log`'s one.

title: chore(ci): update to actions/checkout@v4
body: Updates to `actions/checkout@v4` from version 3.

title: chore(ci): use cargo-hack --no-dev-deps option to check without dev-dependencies
body: Uses `cargo-hack`'s `--no-dev-deps` option to check without dev-dependencies as with https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/pull/3342.

title: Drop Send requirements on the future returned by the service
body: The current bounds appear to be too strict when it comes to `Send`ness, preventing the usage of `auto` in combination with an implementation of `Executor` that's designed to spawn `!Send` futures.

title: refactor(common): replace Never with Infallible
body: Replaces `Never` with `std::convert::Infallible` as with https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/pull/3335.

title: Added `.with_upgrades()` to connection
body:
In all honesty, I really don't know if it's possible to have this happen in the same function with a `?Send` way, but I couldn't get that to work. So I added a new function that requires the IO stream to be `Send`, which automatically upgrades HTTP/1 connections.

Also, does HTTP/2 not require upgrades? I was looking for a similar `.with_upgrades()` function in `self.http2.serve_connection`, and when I couldn't find it, I tried adding it, and realized that there was no `upgrades` module at all. Is this inherently present in HTTP/2 or is this just something that we haven't implemented yet?

This is required by tokio-rs/axum#2241

title: fix: replace std::task::ready with futures_util::ready
body: Replaces `std::task::ready` with `futures_util::ready`, as the former requires Rust 1.64, which is larger than `hyper-util`'s MSRV 1.63.

title: fix: auto conn infinite loop if conn closed before send full bytes
feat: upgrade to hyper 1.0.0-rc.4, add TokioIo
Fix todo!() errors in legacy client
body:
Replace the `todo!()` with relevant errors from `hyper::Error`.

I saw https://github.com/istio/ztunnel/issues/525 mention some not implemented errors in the legacy.rs client. I'm just an observer of both projects but figured I could make an attempt to clean up some of these `todo!()`s with something relevant from the hyper 0.14 side of things.

Feel free to close if this is way off, but this seems like a simple fix as folks are smoothing out the API.

cc @howardjohn

title: chore(ci): update ci config
body:
Updates ci configs.

- Updates to use actions/checkout@v3 from v1.
- Replaces actions-rs/toolchain with dtolnay/rust-toolchain as it is unmaintained.
- Replaces actions-rs/cargo with run as it is unmaintained.
- Replaces `cargo install` with taiki-e/install-action to install cargo-hack to avoid compiling it every ci.
- Removes redundant step names.

title: Add set_interface connector option
body:
This is a duplicate of https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/pull/3076 (which itself was a duplicate of https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/pull/2484).

If I understand hyper 1 correctly, then this essentially moves that PR from being against the `v0.14` branch to the `v1` branch.

title: client: add timer() option
body: Currently, a timer must be provided to use http2. However, this has no option to actually configure this. This PR introduces a new function to set the timer. With this, I am able to successfully make HTTP2 calls with the Client (as long as there is no error - currently we hit a todo!() on errors)

title: Unlock once_cell version
body: In CI MSRV is set to 1.56. It seems lock once_cell to 1.14 is not necessary，and this lock cause conflict with many other crates.

title: Fix legacy client feature config
body: Legacy Client's feature config seems not correct, and example has compile error.

title: Fix client builder argument missing in doc
feat(client): port the hyper 0.14 as `legacy::Client`
body: Closes https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/3147

title: pool: introduce generic Key parameter
body:
This PR makes pooling generic over the Key type, so the caller can decide how they wish to pool the client connections.

This PR builds on the work done by @EItanya (my colleague who is going OOO for a bit, so I took over) in https://github.com/hyperium/hyper-util/pull/12.

Since that PR, support for the `runtime` feature was introduced, and a blanket impl was added for Key (see https://github.com/hyperium/hyper-util/pull/12#discussion_r1049919896).

With this and https://github.com/hyperium/hyper-util/pull/15 pulled locally, I was able to get a full custom pooling implementation in our project. edit: actually only can pool with `Reservation::Unique` at this point since SendRequest isn't `Clone` and `into_http2()` is private. But those can be addressed I think.

title: pool: make relevant items `pub`
body:
Currently `pool` is not pub, and nothing `pub` uses it, so it isn't accessible. This exposes them for use.

Discussed here: https://discordapp.com/channels/500028886025895936/670880858630258689/1053021031805227109

title: Only export `Never` with associated features
body: This avoids linter errors when not using the runtime feature

title: feat(server): add AutoConnection
body:
Closes hyperium/hyper#2852.

This utility automatically detects HTTP protocol and uses its implementation.

title: feat(client): `HttpConnector::tcp_keepalive_interval` and `HttpConnec…
body:
…tor::tcp_keepalive_retries` (#2991)

    If the platform supports setting the options, otherwise it's a noop.

Port from https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/pull/2991

title: fix: add missing feature flags
body:
Closes https://github.com/hyperium/hyper-util/issues/7.

This PR:
* adds missing feature flags that were referenced in code, but not in `Cargo.toml`: `runtime`, `tcp`, `http1`, `http2`
* copies `Never` struct from `hyper` and uses it in `client` module to make it compile when features are enabled
* fixes 3 Clippy warnings about preferring `Copy` to `Clone`

There is one test still failing: `client::connect::http::tests::client_happy_eyeballs`. It's a bit over my head, so I didn't attempt to fix it.

title: feat(rt): add TokioExecutor
body:
Hey Sean,
I decided to give https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/2861 a go. I'd like to ramp up the contributions after that.

Not certain what exactly is required, feel free to require additional changes.
I tried to write some basic test, but I don't know of a good way to wait for a spawned task without retaining the handle.

Also, I have a question. Why does the `Executor` trait require a generic parameter, wouldn't it make sense to only require it on `execute` function? I.e.:
```
fn execute<Fut>(&self, fut: Fut)
```

Closes https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/2861

title: feat(pool): import client::pool from hyper
body:
I'm giving https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/2860 a go, but I'm not sure I'm going in the right direction.

Appreciate if you could take a look when you have time @seanmonstar 

---

Some questions:

Some part of `pool` uses `hyper::Errors`

```log
error[E0624]: associated function `new_canceled` is private
   --> src/client/pool.rs:592:41
    |
592 | ...                   HyperError::new_canceled().with(CheckoutIsClosedError)
    |                                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^ private associated function
    |
   :::
    |
247 |     pub(super) fn new_canceled() -> Error {
    |     ------------------------------------- private associated function defined here
```

I'd imagine that it's probably best to expose these functions from `hyper::Error`, but I'm not sure that this would follow the plan for `hyper-util`?

title: feat(client): import client::connect from hyper
body: Closes https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/2859

title: chore(lib): initialize repo skeleton
body: Closes https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/issues/2838
